narrative.title: 25 Divisione Di Fanteria Bologna - 1940Q4

situation.formation_date: Peacetime formation, activated for war service 1940
situation.deployment_history: Deployed to Libya June 1940, garrisoned Bir al-Ghanam southwest of Tripoli. Participated in Italian invasion of Egypt September 1940 (advance to Sidi Barrani). Defensive role during Operation Compass December 1940.
situation.operational_status_1940q4: Active garrison/defensive operations, moderate combat readiness, supply limitations
situation.notes: Binary (binaria) division with 2 infantry regiments rather than traditional 3-regiment organization. AS-type divisions in Libya received enhanced motor transport and light tank battalion but eliminated pack animals. Bologna Division was one of four AS divisions in Libya in 1940 (along with Pavia, Brescia, and Catanzaro).

narrative.axis_objective: Maintain defensive positions and inflict maximum casualties on Allied forces.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and secure strategic objectives while minimizing casualties.
